turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: No, not so fast. We have nothing concrete.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: When did that ever stop you? You can't sit on this. This is huge.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: If I'm gonna blow this up -- I need hard proof.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: But it's so much easier when we make it up.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Not this time. I owe Cotton that much. Hell, even I thought that man was guilty.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: What's the plan?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Prep the compact, we'll hide it in a window and tape all of tonight's festivities.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: The control board's glitched. You know we can't carry a live picture.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What's the delay?

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: About thirty seconds.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: As long as it records I don't give a shit. We're not doing a remote.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: It's okay, Tatum. She's just doing her job. Right, GALE?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Yes, that's right.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: How's the book?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: It'll be out later this year.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I'll look for it.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I'll send you a copy.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I'm not here to fight.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Just stay back.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I want to talk to you.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Kenny. Camera. Now.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Off the record. No cameras.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Please. You owe me.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I owe you shit.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You owe my mother.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Your mother's murder was last year's hottest court case. Somebody was gonna write a book about it.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: And it had to be you with all your lies and bullshit theories.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What is your problem? You got what you wanted. Cotton Weary is in jail. They're gonna gas him. A book is not gonna change that.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Do you still think he's innocent?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: He was convicted in a court of law. Your testimony put him away. It doesn't matter what I think.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: During the trial, you did all those stories about me. You called me a liar.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I think you falsely identified him. Yes.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Have you talked to Cotton?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Many times.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Has his story changed?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Not one word. He admits to having sex with your mother but that's all.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: He's lying. She wouldn't have touched him. He raped her, then butchered her. Her blood was all over his coat.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: He was drunk that night. He left his coat at your house, after your mother seduced him...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I saw him leaving wearing it.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: But couldn't it have been someone else you saw wearing that coat? The same person who planted it in Cotton's car, framing him? The same person who really killed your mother?

turns.speaker: GIRL #1
turns.text: She was never attacked. I think she made it all up.

turns.speaker: GIRL #2
turns.text: Why would she lie about it?

turns.speaker: GIRL #1
turns.text: For attention. The girl has some serious issues.

turns.speaker: GIRL #1
turns.text: What if she did it? What if Sidney killed Casey and Steve?

turns.speaker: GIRL #2
turns.text: And why would she do that?

turns.speaker: GIRL #1
turns.text: Maybe she was hot for Steve and killed them both in a jealous rage.

turns.speaker: GIRL #2
turns.text: Why would Sidney want to be with Steve? She has her own bubble-butt boyfriend Billy.

turns.speaker: GIRL #1
turns.text: Maybe she's a slut just like her mom.

turns.speaker: GIRL #2
turns.text: You're evil.

turns.speaker: GIRL #1
turns.text: Please, it's common knowledge. Her mother was a trollop.

turns.speaker: GIRL #2
turns.text: Cut some slack. She watched her mom get butchered.

turns.speaker: GIRL #1
turns.text: And it fucked her up royally. Think about it. It makes perfect sense. Her mom's death leaves her distraught and hostile at a cruel and inhumane world, she's disillusioned, where's God, etc. Completely suicidal. And one day she snaps. She wants to kill herself but realizes teen suicide is out this year. And homicide is a much healthier therapeutic expression.

turns.speaker: GIRL #2
turns.text: Where do you get this shit?

turns.speaker: GIRL #1
turns.text: Ricki Lake.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I have no idea.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Scary night, isn't it? With the murders and all, it's like right out of a horror movie or something.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Aha, Randy, you gave yourself away. Are you calling from work? Tatum's on her way over.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Do you like scary movies, Sidney?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I like that thing you're doing with your voice, Randy. It's sexy.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What's your favorite scary movie?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Don't start. You know I don't watch that shit.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: And why is that?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Because they're all the same. It's always some stupid killer stalking some big breasted girl -- who can't act -- who always runs up the stairs when she should be going out the front door. They're ridiculous.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Are you alone in the house?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: That is so unoriginal. You disappoint me, Randy.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Maybe that's because I'm not Randy.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: So who are you?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: The question is not who am I. The question is where am I?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: So where are you?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Your front porch.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Why would you call me from my front porch?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: That's the original part.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: So where are you?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Right here.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Can you see me right now?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What am I doing?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Good try, Randy. Tell Tatum to hurry. Bye now.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: If you hang up, you'll die just like your mother.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Hello Sidney.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Poor Billy-boyfriend. An innocent guy doesn't stand a chance with you.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: LEAVEMEALONE!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Looks like you fingered the wrong guy... again.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: MR. PRESCOTT
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Can you knock?

turns.speaker: MR. PRESCOTT
turns.text: I heard screaming.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No you didn't.

turns.speaker: MR. PRESCOTT
turns.text: No? Oh, well... I'm hitting the sack. My flight leaves first thing in the morning. Now the expo runs all weekend so I won't be back til Sunday. There's cash on the table and I'll be staying at the Raleigh Hilton...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: ...out at the airport...

turns.speaker: MR. PRESCOTT
turns.text: ...so call if you need me.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Have a good trip.

turns.speaker: MR. PRESCOTT
turns.text: Sleep tight, sweetie.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Stu was with me last night.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Oooooh... before or after he sliced and diced.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Fuck you, nut case. Where were you last night?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Working, thank you.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: I thought Blockbuster fired you.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Twice.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: THE FOG, TERROR TRAIN, PROM NIGHT -- How come Jamie Lee Curtis is in all these movies?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: She's the Scream Queen.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Stop. Right there.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Don't shoot. It's me.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Don't come any closer.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Listen to me, Sid. I found Tatum. She's dead, she's been killed... I think Stu did it.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Only if it's a nice Meg Ryan movie.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: You got it.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: That was an ice pick -- not exactly the same.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Yeah, Casey and Steve were completely hollowed out. Takes a man to do something like that.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: For about two seconds.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Before she dumped him for Steve.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: And are the police aware you dated the victim?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: What are you saying? That I killed her or something?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: It would certainly improve your high school Q.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Besides --  "Takes a man to do something like that."

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I'm gonna gut your ass in a second.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Did you really put her liver in the mailbox? I hear they found her liver in the mailbox.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Jesus, this place is packed.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: We had a run in the mass murder section.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: You coming tonight?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Yeah, I'm off early -- curfew you know.  Now that's poor taste.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: If you were the only suspect in a senseless bloodbath would you be standing in the horror section?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: It was all a misunderstanding. He didn't do anything.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: You're such a little lap dog. He's got killer printed all over his forehead.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: The why'd the police let him go?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Because, obviously they don't watch enough movies. This is standard horror movie stuff. PROM NIGHT revisited.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Why would he want to kill his own girlfriend?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: There's always some stupid bullshit reason to kill your girlfriend. That's the beauty of it all. Simplicity. Besides, if it's too complicated you lose your target audience.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: So what's his reason?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Maybe Sidney wouldn't have sex with him.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: She's saving herself for you.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Could be. Now that Billy's tried to mutilate her, you think Sid would go out with me?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I think her father did it. How come they can't find his ass?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Because he's probably dead. His body will come popping out in the last reel somewhere... eyes gauged. See, the police are always off track with this shit, if they'd watch PROM NIGHT they'd save time. There's formula to it. A very simple one. Everyone's always a suspect -- the father, the principal, the town derelict...

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Which is you...

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: So while they're off investigating a dead end, Billy, who's been written off as a suspect, is busy planning his next hunting expedition.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: You're absolutely right. I'm the first to admit it. If this were a scary movie, I'd be the prime suspect.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: And what would be your motive?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: It's 1995 -- motives are incidental.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I thought everything was checked out.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: I had 'em hid in the foreign section.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: We could be like two grief stricken students and we'll say really nice things about our good friends who were slaughtered senselessly.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I can cry on cue.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: What's Leatherface doing here?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: He came to make up.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: There goes my chance with Sid.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Like you had one.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I wanna see Jamie Lee's breasts. When do we see Jamie Lee's breasts?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Not until TRADING PLACES in '83. Jamie Lee was always the virgin in horror movies. She didn't show her tits until she went legit.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: There are certain rules that one must abide by in order to successfully survive a horror movie. For instance: 1. You can never have sex. The minute you get a little nookie -- you're as good as gone. Sex always equals death. 2. Never drink or do drugs. The sin factor. It's an extension of number one. And 3. Never, ever, ever, under any circumstances, say "I'll be right back."

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Wanna another beer?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: His movie nut mind has snapped, Sid. He's gone psycho.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Don't listen to him. It's him. He's the one.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Come on, Sid. Give me the gun.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: No, Sid.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: You heard Billy -- shut the fuck up.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Hey, Stu? Didn't you use to date Casey?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Why are they doing this?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Are you kidding? This is like Christmas.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: And to celebrate this impromptu fall break, I propose we have a party. Tonight, my house.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Are you serious?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: My parents are out of town. It'll be like my hurricane bash last year. Nothing extreme. Just a few of us, hangin'.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Remember, there's safety in numbers.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Yeah, okay... whatever.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Cool. See you guys tonight. Bring food.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: If Tatum sees you -- she'll draw blood.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: You guys can go up to my parents room? To talk and... whatever.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Guess, I won't be needing this anymore.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Why are you doing this?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: It's all part of the game.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You're crazy -- both of you.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: The official term is "psychotic".

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You'll never get away with this.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: So Stu, what's your motive? Billy's got one. The police are on their way. What are you going to tell them?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Peer pressure... I'm way to sensitive.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Do you believe this shit?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Oh God! You don't know? Casey Becker and Steve Forrest were killed last night.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: And not just killed, Sid. We're talking splatter movie killed-split open end to end.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Casey Becker? She sits next to me in English.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Not anymore. Her parents found her hanging from a tree. Her insides on the outside.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Do they know who did it?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Fucking clueless -- they're interrogating the entire school. Teachers, students, staff, janitors...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: They think it's school-related?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: They don't know. Dewey said this is the worst crime they've ever seen. Even worse than...  Well it's bad. They're bringing in the feds. This is big.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Or a man's mentality.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: How do you gut someone?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You sure I can stay over? My dad won't be back til Sunday.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: No prob. I'll pick you up after practice.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Tell your mom I said thanks.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Yeah, yeah... are you okay?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Uh-huh, it's just... you know, the police and reporters... it brings it all back.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: I'll be there by seven. I promise

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Thanks, Tatum.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Later.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Practice ran late. I'm on my way.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: It's past seven.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Don't worry. Casey and Steve didn't bite it til way after ten.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I'm not worried.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Good, 'cause I wanna swing by BLOCKBUSTER and get us a video. I was thinkin' Tom Cruise in ALL THE RIGHT MOVES. You know, if you pause it just right you can see his penis.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Whatever. Just hurry.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: It's okay. She was supposed to pick me up.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Her dad's out of town. She's staying with us.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Just another sleepover at the Riley's.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Just like old times, ain't it?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No, nothing's like it used to be.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Do you really think Billy did it?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: He was there, Tatum.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: I knew this guy was too perfect. He was destined to have a flaw.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Take a message.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: It's alright. I'll get it.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Come on, Sid.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Just a sec... I need to talk to someone.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Just relax. You're at school now. No one can get you here.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: But if it wasn't Billy it could be anybody. He could be here at school right now.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: This is a mistake. I shouldn't be here.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: I want you to meet me here right after class, okay?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Shit, what is he doing here?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I bet he's pissed.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Just ignore him. You had good reason to think what you did.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: It was just some sick fuck having a laugh.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: It was him, Tatum. I know it.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: This could be good. What do you think, Sid?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Come on. Pathos has it's perks.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Maybe Cotton Weary is telling the truth. Maybe he was having an affair with your mom.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: So you think my mom was a slut too?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: I didn't say that, Sid. But you know there were rumors. Your dad was always out of town on business. Maybe your mom was a very unhappy woman.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: If they were having an affair how come that Cotton couldn't prove it in court?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: You can't prove a rumor. That's why it's a rumor.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Created by that little tabloid twit Gale Weathers.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: It goes further back, Sid. There's been talk about other men.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: And you believe it?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Well... you can only hear that Richard Gere-gerbil story so many times before you have to start believing it.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: If I was wrong Cotton, then he's still out there.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Don't go there, Sid. You're starting to sound like some Wes Carpenter flick. Don't freak yourself out -- we've got a long night ahead of us.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You're right. I'm cracking up. Ignore me.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Come on, let's rock.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Hey, Sid. Just think if they make a movie about you. Who's gonna play you?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Oh, god...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Is Billy going to be there tonight?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: He better not be. I told Stu to keep his mouth shut. I think we can live without EVERYBODY'S ALL AMERICAN for one night.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Billy's right. Whenever he touches me, I just can't relax.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: You have a few intimacy issues as a result of your mother's untimely death. It's no big deal. You'll thaw out.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: But he's been so patient with me, Tatum. You know, with all the sex stuff. How many guys would put up with a girlfriend who's sexually anorexic?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Billy and his penis don't deserve you.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What do you think about when you're having sex?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: With Stu, there's little time to stop and reflect. But sometimes before, to relax and get in the mood, I think about Grant Goodeve.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Grant Goodeve -- the oldest brother on EIGHT IS ENOUGH. Remember that show? He was the one who lived off alone. He would come around every now and then with his guitar and sing "Eight is enough to fill our lives with love..." He had all these brain dead sisters and that idiot brother from CHARLES IN CHARGE. God, I was in love with Grant, he was so hot. The show came on every day after school right during my puberty years. Grant Goodeve was very instrumental in my maturing as a woman.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: How does that get you in the mood with Stu?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: During foreplay, I sing the theme song to myself. "Eight is enough to fill our lives with love..." It's a real turn on.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Grant wrote the song himself. I'm convinced the lyrics had a secret meaning, "Eight is enough..."

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What secret meaning? Like a Satanical thing?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Watch the show, Sid. His basket is bigger than the one you're pushing.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: TATUM!

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Oh, Sidney. WHAT? A guy can talk tits til he's dead but the minute you mention an eight inch weenie. Watch out.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: There's that sense of humor. I knew it still existed. Ohh, Sid, let's have some fun tonight.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Deal.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Hunt? Why would they ask if you like to hunt?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I don't know, they just did.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Because there's no way a girl could have killed them.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: That is so sexist. The killer could easily be female -- BASIC INSTINCT.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: I thought you dumped her for me.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I did. He's full of shit.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: You know if I were accused of carving up two people, I'd take the opportunity to skip school.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Hey, go easy, Tatum. He didn't do it.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Is this not cool or what? Hey, Sid, what happened?

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: For once, Stu, drop it.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Okay, but whatever you did -- the entire student body thanks you.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: That's mature.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Where you guys been? We had to start without you.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: With that set of lungs -- she should be.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: Tits -- see.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I got it. Tatum get me a beer. They're in the fridge in the garage.

turns.speaker: TATUM
turns.text: What am I? The beer wench?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Hey, guess who's here? It's that chick from INSIDE STORY?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: I don't have anyone else to give this to, Somerset, you know that.  And nobody's going to swap with you.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Give it to me.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: How's that?

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: There's nothing that says I have to work with him.  If Somerset wants out, "goodbye."  Give it to me.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: That's not necessary.  You're in.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Go start picking up the pieces.  We'll shuffle some paper and try to get you a new partner.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: He cuts off the skin if his fingertips. That's why we can't find a single usable print in the apartment.  He's been doing it for quite a while.  Keeps cutting before the papillary line can grow back.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: What about the trace on his bank account and the guns?  There must be something to connect him with a past.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: So far it's all dead ends.  No credit history.  No employment history.  His bank account's only five years old and it started as cash.  We're even trying to trace his furniture, but for now all we know is he's independently wealth, well educated and totally insane.  We may never know how he got that way.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: You don't.  It goes to court now.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: He wouldn't just turn himself in.  It doesn't make any sense.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: He's pissing in our faces again and we're just taking it.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: You're wound too tight, Mills.  Let it go.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: How is it working for a scumbag like this? You proud of yourself?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Ease back, Mills.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: I'm in.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: "Dear Detectives, Long is the way, and hard, that out of hell leads up to light." It's the murderer's way of announcing himself.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Announcing what?

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: There are seven deadly sins.  Gluttony, wrath, greed...

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: So what?  This victim...

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: ... envy, sloth, pride and lust.  Seven.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Hey, so gluttony is one of the seven deadly sins.  But, this was a fat guy.  The killer may have felt this was the just best way to torture him. And, writing on the walls happens all the time.  It's like the fashionable thing to do.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: One is gluttony.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: What's this: "I'm declining this case?"  It don't work that way.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: This can't be my last duty here.  It will go on and on.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: I know what you're thinking, okay?  You don't want to get in bed with this every night, but it's different now.  You're retiring.  In six days you're all the way gone.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: You've left unfinished business before.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Everything else was taken as close to conclusion as humanly possible.  Also... this shouldn't be his first assignment.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Have you heard?

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: No, I haven't heard.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: There was a second.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Already.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Greed.  It was written in blood.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: It's none of my business anymore.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: I thought you might want to be filled in.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: I'm sure everyone's doing their best.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Come on.  What are you going to do with yourself out there?

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: I'll get a job, maybe on a farm.  I'll work on the house.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Can't you feel it yet?  Can't you feel that feeling... ?  You're not going to be a cop anymore.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: You know.
